Text:
[#MOHCOS2023] Reviewing system enablers to support healthcare transformations

MOH aims to table the Health Information in 2H 2023.

MOH will also continue to invest in healthcare infrastructure to meet the needs of our population.  

More info: https://t.co/uJYxogZyWV https://t.co/hAV2d4LMPQ

[#MOHCOS2023] Transforming aged care for seniors to live and age well

MediSave may now be used for homebound patients receiving medical and palliative care.

$1.5b will be topped-up to MediFund in 2023 to provide financial support for needy Singaporeans.
https://t.co/uJYxogZyWV https://t.co/z1M1BFuD28

[#MOHCOS2023] Empowering Healthy Lives

MOH will continue our ongoing efforts to promote healthier living for all ages and families – with Healthier SG enrolment, additional resources to empower residents, and greater support for families.

More info: https://t.co/uJYxogZyWV https://t.co/SvVTnJyve2

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗗𝗶𝗮𝗯𝗲𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 

The National Diabetes Reference Materials (NDRM) Tier 2 materials will be published in April 2023, providing guidelines on physical activities, healthy eating, ways to cope with stresses, and support for Type 1 diabetes.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗽𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿

We will continue to ensure the well-being of our healthcare workers, starting with a healthy working culture and environment.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗽𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿

The salaries of healthcare workers are reviewed regularly to ensure that they are paid competitively.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗽𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿

To meet increasing healthcare needs, we are ramping up recruitment of foreign nurses to complement our local core.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗽𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿

The attrition rate for local nurses has remained stable over 2019 to 2022, but for foreign nurses, this has spiked from 9.5% to 14.5% over the same period.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗽𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿

To attract students from all pathways into suitable healthcare programmes, we are working towards making the entry criteria for each pathway more transparent.
For example, about 430 allied health graduates from the 2022 batch at SIT will enter the workforce in 2026, after increasing the intake by around 85%.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗽𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿

To ensure a stable supply of healthcare professionals, we have increased local intakes of students over time.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹-𝗯𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴

The Taskforce will continue to improve awareness and attitudes towards mental health through public education.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹-𝗯𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴

The Taskforce is developing a national mental health competency training framework to guide mental health professionals in developing knowledge, skills & competencies to deliver high quality and effective care.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹-𝗯𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴

The Interagency Taskforce on Mental Health and Well-being has recommended a tiered care model for mental healthcare delivery to better coordinate care provision and referrals for different mental health needs.
c)govern the collection, use and disclosure of such data by setting out robust cyber and data security requirements.
b)allow healthcare providers to share health and administrative data with one another for specific purposes.
a)enable the collection of patients’ selected health data from healthcare providers.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗕𝗶𝗹𝗹

The Health Information Bill, which will be tabled in 2H 2023, seeks to:

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗞𝗲𝗲𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝘆

2 regional pilots will be launched to provide children from low-income families with a good head start in health – Project HOME and HEADS-UPP.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗞𝗲𝗲𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝘆

NUH will be extending its mental health screening and support to fathers of children and husbands of women under its care.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗞𝗲𝗲𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝘆

📱🧒We have launched a new advisory on screen use for children up to 12 years of age to provide parents with more resources and practical help to support their children on healthy screen and device use.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗞𝗲𝗲𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝘆

Since Dec 2022, KKH has implemented the PRAM programme, which offers universal antenatal mental health screening for all pregnant women receiving outpatient obstetric care at the hospital.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗞𝗲𝗲𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝘆

Mother-child dyad services will be expanded from 9 polyclinics to 14 polyclinics by 2025.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗞𝗲𝗲𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝘆

Family Nexus will be progressively rolled out at Choa Chu Kang, Punggol and Sembawang over the next few months.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗙𝗹𝗲𝘅𝗶𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀

Tan Tock Seng Hospital and Dover Park Hospice will embark on a pilot programme to provide seamless care across inpatient, day and home hospice settings.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗙𝗹𝗲𝘅𝗶𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀

We will strengthen support for palliative care to fulfil patients’ wishes to spend their final days at home rather than in hospitals.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗔𝗳𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝘁 𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲

We will continue incorporating telehealth in our care models, where appropriate. 🧑‍⚕️💻

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗔𝗳𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝘁 𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲

In 2H 2023, we will extend the use of MediSave to homebound patients receiving home medical care. They will be able to tap on the MediSave500/700 and Flexi-MediSave schemes.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗔𝗴𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝘆

👵👴For our seniors to stay healthy, it is important for them to age actively in the community, surrounded by their family and friends.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗚 𝗕𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁𝘀

From early 2024, enrolled residents under the Chronic Disease Management Programme can use MediSave to pay for their full treatment without cash co-payment.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗚 𝗕𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁𝘀

From early 2024, CHAS cardholders enrolled to Healthier SG GP clinics with higher chronic medication requirements and bills can opt for Healthier SG Chronic Tier subsidies of up to 87.5% for whitelisted medications.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗚 𝗕𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁𝘀

From July 2023, nationally recommended health screenings and vaccinations will be free for residents enrolled in Healthier SG.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗚 𝗕𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁𝘀

From July 2023, residents enrolled in Healthier SG will be awarded 3,000 Healthpoints worth $20 after their first Health Plan consultation.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗚 𝗕𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁𝘀

From July 2023, residents enrolled in Healthier SG can go for their first Health Plan consultation with their chosen family physician, free of charge.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗚 𝗘𝗻𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁

From July 2023, residents aged 60 and above can enrol. Remaining residents will also be progressively invited to enrol.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗚 𝗘𝗻𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁

From May 2023, residents aged 40 and above with chronic illnesses, and are regular patients of a Healthier SG-registered GP can pre-enrol.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗲𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘄𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗡𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 

Sembawang and Tampines North Polyclinics will start operations this year. Another 8 polyclinics will be completed by 2030.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗲𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘄𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗡𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 

Preparatory works for the redevelopment of Alexandra Hospital and the new Eastern Integrated Health Campus are in progress.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗲𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘄𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗡𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 

The new National Skin Centre, Tan Tock Seng Hospital Integrated Care Hub and Woodlands Health Campus will be progressively opened by end-2023.

[#MOHCOS2023] 𝗠𝗲𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘄𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗡𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀
 
We target to add 1,900 more public hospital beds over the next 5 years, on top of about 11,000 existing beds.
We will be sharing live updates from MOH's Committee of Supply Debate shortly. Watch this space! #MOHCOS2023

⛑️ Vaccination remains our primary defence against COVID-19.

💉 COVID-19 vaccinations under the National Vaccination Programme will also continue to be offered free of charge to all Singapore Citizens, PRs, LTPH and STPH.

For more info, visit https://t.co/kdqVcPH5GC https://t.co/E1dAn4pUv8

📣 The Ministerial Committee on Ageing (MCA) has launched the 2023 Action Plan for Successful Ageing.  

👵🏼 It will focus on community initiatives to empower Singaporeans to take charge of their own ageing journeys.

➡️ For more info, visit https://t.co/DQHMaDTHkZ https://t.co/TujJd9rhgC

She gave sugar a bitter ending. Can she take down a new, salty foe in time for Reunion Dinner?
 
This Chinese New Year, leap 🐇 into the Healthier SG multiverse with the Guardian of Health!
 
#少盐少钠过好年 #LessSaltBetterHealth #HealthierSG

https://t.co/U23OXXponA
🎆 🎊 Happy New Year! We wish you good health and happiness in 2023! https://t.co/tenGR6aTqQ

🎶 Tis’ the season to be healthy!

🎄 Season’s Greetings everyone!

🎁  Let’s remember to stay safe and be socially responsible as we celebrate this year-end season with our family and loved ones. https://t.co/WD1zuntj3O

🎄 Ho-ho-ho! The festive season is here.

🥳 As we indulge in the festive feasting, here are some tips to prepare delicious yet healthy meals for you and your loved ones.

👍 As always, remember to eat and drink in moderation. Stay safe and happy holidays! https://t.co/3dky1nrmgW

🎅 Have you been naughty or nice this year? 

🎁 During this festive season, let’s continue to be socially responsible. Stay home if unwell. Practise good personal hygiene. And self-test regularly, especially before visiting vulnerable people.

🎄 Have fun and stay safe! https://t.co/suoVXO0tHz

✈️ Travelling overseas this festive season? Excited and yet a bit worried about COVID-19? 

🕺💃 So are Father Long and Auntie Andie!

👂Listen in on their secret and the important “V” in their travel plans. 

👀 Watch and learn strategies to stay safe! https://t.co/jahdTwmvaQ

📢 From 12 Dec 2022, the bivalent Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty vaccine will be available for primary series and boosters for those 12 years and above.

🛡 All JTVCs and MVTs will offer bivalent Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnaty and bivalent Moderna/Spikevax.

🔗Info: https://t.co/K39G1h4mJo https://t.co/2mHaeATgyf

⏰ Does it matter what time I take my medication?

🥘 Should all medication be taken after food?

💊 Reading your medication label correctly will help you get the most out of your prescription!

🔗 Learn how to read your medication labels here: https://t.co/ywUURJEQwf https://t.co/X58kAdEvlp

🤔 Have you ever searched multiple websites for medication-related info, only to wonder if they are credible?

🔗 https://t.co/Vqor5LfgkG https://t.co/m7MCf0jUgD

Are you up to date with your COVID-19 vaccination?
 
If you are aged 18 and above, you should receive an additional dose of bivalent vaccine at least 5 months from your last dose.
 
For more info, visit: https://t.co/A5cwxsJMHs https://t.co/FMOAG3U1cR

💉 Keeping our vaccinations up to date is our first key line of defence against COVID-19.

➡️ Have you received your minimum protection series? Swipe to check if you’re up to date with your COVID-19 vaccinations.

🔗 For more info, visit https://t.co/RPgIM4zfCp https://t.co/Cgl5X5eHOu

🦠 As reinfections become more common, self-test regularly to protect your loved ones.

➡️ Swipe to find out when you should self-test, and what you should do if you experience symptoms 28 days after your previous infection.

🔗 To learn more, visit https://t.co/RPgIM4RoQx https://t.co/NS79p1v9R6

The best protection we can give our children against COVID-19 is through vaccination. From 25 Oct 2022, children 6 mth - 4 yr can begin to receive their primary vaccination, while children 5 - 11 yr can begin to receive their booster shot.

For more info: https://t.co/borIiXT1Pd https://t.co/eXuH4ssCS3

🛡 The best protection we can give our children against COVID-19 is through vaccination. 

💉 From 25 Oct, children aged 6 months to 4 can receive their primary vaccination, while children aged 5 to 11 can receive their booster shot. 

👩‍⚕️ Get your children vaccinated asap! https://t.co/L69T2G8PtD

🤧 Having mild flu-like symptoms and require medical help?

👨‍💻👩‍⚕️Consider teleconsultation with a doctor. This saves you travelling time, and allows you to have medications delivered right to your doorstop. 

🔗 For a list of telemedicine providers, visit https://t.co/LrkMW54q3e https://t.co/uO1IL9L7PQ

📈 The increasing use of Big Data and Artificial Intelligence is changing the landscape of biomedical science and research. 

🤓 To learn more about the accompanying bioethical considerations, sign up for this panel discussion organised by BAC at https://t.co/ske28pqEWJ https://t.co/ZFIKhNU0JB

✅ As we resume normalcy in our daily activities, we will lift Vaccination Differentiated SMMs (VDS) fully from 10 Oct 2022. 

👩‍⚕️ Even as we lift VDS, we urge non-fully vaccinated persons to get vaccinated to protect themselves.

ℹ️ For more info: https://t.co/q07c3XV0vx https://t.co/vqYGb0p4w2

⛹️‍♂️ With #HealthierSG, you can lead a more active and healthier life.

👀 Check out the infographic for some of the benefits you can enjoy when the programme launches from 2H 2023, starting with enrolment for those aged 60 and above.

🔗 Find out more at https://t.co/9kxoeCXHhX. https://t.co/eZxbM7YIgq

🤔 What is bioethics? What are some common bioethical issues? Why should we be concerned?

🔗 For more info on bioethics, and the work that Singapore's Bioethics Advisory Committee does, visit 
https://t.co/7iZ5rkt3Ql https://t.co/NBXGOOzbvj

📣 From 2H 2023, residents aged 60 and above can enrol with a family doctor, who will help them manage their health holistically. Enrolment for those aged 40-59 will follow in the next 2 years. 

🔗 For more info, visit https://t.co/JKHWwaQh0h. https://t.co/4WPuU4yfzu

🍎Healthier SG seeks to empower you to become healthier through preventive care, and will be launched in the second half of 2023.

👀 Check out this infographic to learn more about the 5 key features of Healthier SG. For more info, visit https://t.co/JKHWwaQh0h. https://t.co/cB0zU93qID

🤝 Since March 2022, MOH has engaged over 6,000 residents and stakeholders on Healthier SG, where a vast majority agreed that their health lies in how well they care for themselves. 

👀 Check out this infographic for the key findings from the Healthier SG engagement. https://t.co/88ZIp5GZFU

🧬 Interested to learn more about your ancestry, personality or behavioural traits? Be wary when doing so through non-clinical or direct-to-consumer (DTC) genetic tests.

🔎 For more info on DTC genetic tests, visit https://t.co/0UOEofKEiQ https://t.co/He2NxwN3Lq

👋 Say Hi to our otter family!

⚠️ Beware of scams or phishing attempts!

🤧 Having mild flu-like symptoms and require medical help? 

👨‍💻👩‍⚕️Consider telemedicine consultation with a doctor. This saves you travelling time, allows you to avoid queueing at the clinics. 

🔗 For a list of telemedicine providers, visit https://t.co/uLGCQCIWPz https://t.co/MjhSB0dphp

Calling all Singaporeans! Have you completed the #HealthierSG survey?

🔗 https://t.co/ICN7aksDF9 https://t.co/YJ599Iu2QE

Did you know that colorectal cancer is the most common cancer affecting men in Singapore? 

The good news is, about a third of all cancers can be cured if they are detected and treated early. 

That is why regular health check-ups and cancer screenings are important. https://t.co/JGtV1OLTX5

Healthier SG will help all Singaporeans take steps towards better health. From today to 15 Aug, we invite you to share your views and suggestions with us, to help shape Healthier SG together. 

To take part in our survey, visit https://t.co/swSFnY00gG https://t.co/azO0lBPL4e

Registration for the Nuvaxovid vaccine by Novavax has begun.

Individuals aged 18 years and above may receive the vaccine for their primary series or booster vaccination. 

Swipe right to find out when, where and how you can receive the vaccine. https://t.co/81zq0A6N74

To date, more than 5,500 cases of dengue have been reported this year, already exceeding last year's total! 😱

Know the symptoms and do the Mozzie Wipeout regularly to protect yourself and your family! 🚫🦟

For more info on dengue: https://t.co/nrahxi2Mwe https://t.co/HgfT4o6lk3

From today (8 April), the following grps can receive their 2nd booster dose abt 5 mth after their 1st booster dose:
✔️ All persons aged 80 years & above

MOH has formed a new Workgroup to design culturally relevant programmes for the ethnic minority groups, to improve their overall health and well-being. https://t.co/kqj8Kk1CXk

The COVID-19 Mental Wellness Taskforce set up to look into the psycho-social impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the population, will evolve into an inter-agency platform on mental health and well-being by mid-2021.

Since the launch of the Community Mental Health Masterplan in 2012, we have increased the capacity of community mental health services; over 220 GP partners and 14 polyclinics provide mental health & dementia services to diagnose, treat and care for patients. https://t.co/r6dN1Fbjt9

The Institute of Mental Health has also embarked on infrastructure refurbishment works to improve its facilities in line with its evolving care model. The refurbished campus is expected to be completed by end 2022.
By around 2030, we will have a total of 12 acute hospitals and 8 community hospitals. https://t.co/HkKgG2cQPm

Between now to 2030, we will open another 12 polyclinics, bringing the total number of polyclinics to 32 by 2030. Clementi Polyclinic will be redeveloped at a new site by 2027. https://t.co/TKoOHC02GT

Rehab care will be strengthened with the National One-Rehab framework, which aims to facilitate patients’ access to the appropriate type & level of rehab care in a timely manner. https://t.co/inszOgXbnL

We are also working with healthcare employers to review career pathways for staff working in healthcare and operations support roles, to broaden options for their further development. https://t.co/yd9XCBFhXJ

About 56,300 staff in the public healthcare institutions will receive an increase in their monthly base salaries. Funding support for salaries to publicly-funded community care organisations will also be increased. https://t.co/cXm2CCx6Ww

2 new National Central Fill Pharmacies will be set up to consolidate medication delivery across public healthcare institutions to make medication delivery more convenient for patients and caregivers. https://t.co/OZsVAYO0Pd
Flexi-MediSave limit to be raised from $200 per year to $300 per year from 1 June 2021 to better support elderly patients.
2 new subsidy tiers in the SOC setting will be introduced for patients whose per capita household income is above $3,300. https://t.co/1JwBZjKuP8

The maximum subsidy level at community hospitals will be raised to 80% of the hospitalisation bill. The minimum subsidy level will be raised to 30%. 95% of sub-acute and rehab patients are expected to benefit from higher subsidies. https://t.co/RVmoofNOFQ

MOH will change the basis of means-testing in the acute inpatient setting from individual monthly income to per capita household income (PCHI). This ensures that subsidies are better directed towards those who need it more.

MOH will introduce a set of changes to the means-tested subsidy frameworks for inpatient care at acute hospitals and community hospitals, and specialist outpatient clinic care. https://t.co/pKPkvW2zgB

We will progressively roll out an enhanced suite of services at eldercare centres from 1 May & set aside about $180m for rollout of over 200 Active Ageing Centres & Active Ageing Care Hubs by 2024. This will allow seniors to stay active & take charge of their health. https://t.co/rLPk48D3im

The Action Plan will focus on the 3 ‘C’s - Care, Contribution & Connectedness which aim to delay the onset of chronic illnesses, empower seniors to contribute to society & ensure seniors remain connected to society. https://t.co/B7HSS61jgY

The demographics of our seniors are changing. The Ministerial Committee of Ageing is refreshing the Action Plan for Successful Ageing, to ensure it continues to meet the needs of the seniors. The refreshed Action Plan is targeted to be launched in 2022.

2M for Health, Mr Masagos Zulkifli, will chair an inter-agency taskforce to oversee the implementation of the Action Plan. The Taskforce will bring various agencies together to address issues to help achieve better health, social and education outcomes for our young. https://t.co/j09l412Xbk
The Strategy and Action Plan will span from the pre-conception phase to adolescents aged 18 years old.

The lowest income quintile’s share of total subsidies was 37% in 2018, the highest across all income quintiles. From 2013 to 2018, the amount of subsidies received per household for the lowest income quintile has also increased by over 70%.
The government continues to bear a significant and growing share of the National Health Expenditure, from 40% in 2013 to 46% in 2018. https://t.co/wdLj6LXTiB

How will we continue to provide accessible, affordable and better care for all Singaporeans? What does it take to enable a future-ready healthcare system? Follow us here and on Facebook for key highlights of the Ministry of Health’s Committee of Supply (COS). https://t.co/65khhbHNfW

The Virtual Health Booklet is expected be launched in end-2020. The booklet will delivery personalised nudges to empower individuals to take charge of their health!
To improve follow-up after health screening, we will pilot tele-coaching for people found to be at risk of cardiovascular diseases through the Screen for Life programme this year.
Health Promotion Board will roll out the Healthy Living Passport in mid-2020 to help lower-income families improve their health literacy and encourage them to lead healthy lifestyles.
New smoking cessation models will be piloted at our public healthcare institutions such as hospitals, polyclinics and national speciality centres. https://t.co/CWJQNWqQEQ
The smoking rate in Singapore dropped to 10.6% in 2019. We are drawing close to our stretch target of reducing the smoking rate to below 10% by 2020!

SPS Amrin Amin announced that subsidies for all nationally recommended vaccinations and childhood developmental screenings will be extended to all CHAS GP clinics and polyclinics by end-2020. https://t.co/qVKBzFmHHL
Singaporeans can also look forward to more water dispensers being installed in hawker centres, bus interchanges and terminals to encourage the consumption of plain water. https://t.co/mdfbNNARCt

To help Singaporeans make more informed dietary choices, Nutri-Grade labelling and advertising measures for pre-packaged beverages will start from end-2021. We will also extend the labelling and advertising measures to freshly prepared beverages https://t.co/1oqhBSt5Ov
Patients can continue to tap on their own and their family members' MediSave accounts, up to the patient's own annual withdrawal limit for the treatment.

Healthcare professionals will be updated with best available evidence on a range of clinical topics through individualised, face-to-face discussions. Useful resources such as those that assist in explaining health conditions or treatment options to patients will also be shared.

By 2030, we will have 12 public acute hospitals and eight public community hospitals. https://t.co/Kw5ErpgJvz

The Fees Benchmarks Advisory Committee will study fee benchmarks for less common surgical procedures, doctors’ inpatient consultation fees and anaesthetist’s fees. Recommendations will be submitted to MOH by end of this year. https://t.co/qULLf5Gbmp
Youths at-risk of mental health will receive individualised emotional support, needs identifications and peer support services.
Integrated Youth Service, a one-stop service for youths to access coordinated mental health and social support services in the community, will start this year in Woodlands. https://t.co/vaDXl39wnv
This is part of our efforts to ensure that all Singaporeans have access to affordable and quality care, close to their homes.

An eldercare centre will be co-located at the block, to provide active ageing and befriending services to seniors in the neighbourhood, including seniors at the assisted living block. https://t.co/QcdKhxcD2i
The flats will be designed with residents’ future needs in mind, including larger bathrooms and pre-installed senior-friendly fittings such as grab bars.
The Assisted Living Typology (ALT) concept flats will be senior-friendly in design, and come with a package of programmes and services that caters to seniors’ needs over time.
We are working closely with the @MNDSingapore and @SingaporeHDB to develop an assisted living model in public housing, where housing is twinned with care services.

In addition to these baseline support services, half of the eldercare centres will eventually also provide higher level care services, such as day care and community rehabilitation services, to cater to those who are more frail. https://t.co/150awsJ4PL

Services include active ageing programmes for the well, befriending services for the lonely, and information and referral for care services for frail seniors. These services will be available to all seniors in each neighbourhood.

Woodlands Health Campus and the Tan Tock Seng Hospital (@TTSH) Integrated Care Hub at Novena are scheduled to open progressively from 2022.

As of 7 Feb 2020, 2pm, we have confirmed three additional cases of 2019 novel coronavirus infection in Singapore. While contact tracing is underway, there are not yet any links to previous cases or travel history to China. Read more: https://t.co/0668gxOvSA

With the heightened risk posture of DORSCON Orange, we will be introducing additional precautionary measures to minimise the risk of further transmission of the virus in the community. Read more: https://t.co/UnwqiPtHwA

As there are now a few local cases without any links to previous cases or travel history to China, we have stepped up our risk assessment from DORSCON Yellow to DORSCON Orange. Read more: https://t.co/UnwqiPtHwA

Today, we have confirmed three additional cases of 2019 novel coronavirus infection in Singapore. Contact tracing is underway; as of now, we have not uncovered links to previous cases or travel history to China. Read more: https://t.co/UnwqiPtHwA
Contact tracing for Case 29 (announced on 6 February) so far has not established a link to previous cases or travel history to mainland China. Read more: https://t.co/UnwqiPtHwA
We stand ready to ramp up our measures even more once we have some findings from the ongoing investigations. Read more: https://t.co/kaHY01NdDN

This has already happened in several places outside of mainland China. We had earlier stepped up significantly our precautionary measures to reduce the risk of community spread of the virus. Read more: https://t.co/kaHY01NdDN

But we must be prepared for the possibility of new infection clusters involving locals within the community, not linked with recent travel to China or contact with recent PRC travellers. Read more: https://t.co/kaHY01NdDN

Thus far all our previously announced confirmed cases have been either PRC travellers from Hubei, or individuals with links to PRC travellers.  All such cases have been isolated and ring-fenced. Read more: https://t.co/kaHY01NdDN

This case was confirmed late last night and contact tracing is still in progress, with focus on identifying any links it may have with past cases or travellers from China. We will provide further updates tomorrow as the investigations progress. Read more: https://t.co/kaHY01NdDN
The other case has no recent travel history to mainland China and does not appear to be linked with previous cases. Read more: https://t.co/kaHY01NdDN

There is as yet no evidence of widespread community transmission in Singapore. Read more: https://t.co/ufcGzqPqgO
